results.title: Suspects all
results.creator_credit: Ronald H. Riley, R.H.R. Productions, Film Producers Guild and Anthony Pelissier
results.brief_description: A dramatised fatal factory fire and its investigation shows how such accidents can result from carelessness, fire hazards such as litter, poor building design, overloaded electrical circuits and lack of fire drill for the staff.

results.title: Surviving the Outback Rivers
results.brief_description: The vast Australian Outback has been described as a land of heroes and dead men. Join Scott Lambert and seven Australian army commandoes who are all recipients of the green beret on a three week rafting expedition, where enough provisions for one week have been taken, with the idea of “living off the land” for most of the time. Setting out from Darwin, the journey will take these adventurers down the Katherine River through the Katherine Gorge, then back through the Clarevale Crossing and the Daly River Crossing, back to Darwin. A fascinating adventure amongst some of the most beautiful wilderness in Australia.

results.title: Surviving sexual assault
results.creator_credit: Ross Hutchens, Western Australia. Dept. of Health. Video Production Unit, West-Ed Media and Heather Williams
results.brief_description: A sexual assault counsellor debunks myths about rape describing women’s responses and both short and long term effects. Explores the diverse reactions of women who have been sexually abused or assaulted through vox pops, professional advice, interviews and non-exploitative reconstructions. Outlines the healing process and support for the victim and those close to her. Accompanied by a 24p. booklet for partners, friends, family members or professional workers.

results.title: Surviving Parenthood (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Two different groups of parents discuss their feelings and attitudes about coping with children in an honest and unaffected way. Highlights the difficulties couples have adjusting to parenthood and the success or otherwise of “bonding”.
results.description: Two different groups of parents discuss their feelings and attitudes about coping with children in an honest and unaffected way. Highlights the difficulties couples have adjusting to parenthood and the success or otherwise of “bonding”.

results.title: Survival swimming. - [Rev. ed.]
results.brief_description: Children and adults are seen enjoying themselves in, and on, water, and two survival situations are depicted. Demonstrates treading water, endurance swimming (suitable strokes), surface diving, swimming under water, entry into water, exit and use of rope ladder. Designed to encourage swimmers to learn how to survive in emergency situations. Revised edition of Title Code 010476.

results.title: Survival run
results.creator_credit: Joaquin Padro, Pyramid Films, Magus Films and Robert Charlton
results.brief_description: Presents the determination and cooperation between a blind man (Harry Cordellos) and his sighted partner (Mike Restani) when they took on the grueling Dipsea cross-country race over the California mountains and through rain forests. “The Dipsea Race is like life. You don’t win it…you survive it.” Harry Cordellos.

results.title: Survival of the fittest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Small Business”
Why small businesses grow or die - an investigation based on interviews with the principals of a number of firms, ranging from a one-man factory that is doing well to a dynamic enterprise. Gives examples of the special problems of those who inherit a family firm. Small firms are especially vulnerable but sometimes compensate with special satisfactions.
